channel.title: Opticvps
channel.description:
I just bought the $40.00 VPS and i am really confused on what to do now. I know how to get the server on the VPS but i can't figure out how to access the VPS. Help would be greatly appreciated.
Post here or add me on msn: xskaterx1165@aol.com

item.title: Opticvps
item.dc:creator: @pkpoison pkpoison
item.description:
@pkpoison wrote:

John459:

It takes 24-48 hours for you to get the ip and pass. I use them and it took them almost two days to send me that information.

Okay, thanks. They e-mailed me saying i would get my info in an hour but its been 8 hours. I’ll check when I get back from school hopefully it’ll be done.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 22, 2009, 05:02:47 am[/size][hr][quote=“Runes Are Cool?, post:12, topic:303625”]Lesson-Don’t spend your money unless you’ve made sure they’re legit…[/quote]

Lol, I have made sure they’re legit. Over 10 people said its the best choice so i guess i looked into it enough.

Read full topic

item.title: Opticvps
item.dc:creator: @pkpoison pkpoison
item.description:
@pkpoison wrote:

Dell:

lol yeah if the vps is too good to be true it could be a scam, if there live chat redirects you that shouldnt happen , try emailing them back and asking for the ip and password.

I don’t think it could be a scam because many others have said these where great and reliable.

Read full topic

item.title: Opticvps
item.dc:creator: @pkpoison pkpoison
item.description:
@pkpoison wrote:

[quote=“Dell, post:6, topic:303625”]they have to send you the ip of your vps and the password, try talking to customer service if they havent sent it to you yet .

But if you did receive it, just go to “start” than "all programs " than go to the folder “accessories” and look for “remote desktop connection” / or you can just run your search.cmd and search for “remote desktop connection” and just type in the ip of ur vps and the password and than youll be able to setup your server on there .[/quote]
Actually they haven’t sent me the e-mail should i contact them.

Read full topic

item.title: Opticvps
item.dc:creator: @Dell Dell
item.description:
@Dell wrote:

they have to send you the ip of your vps and the password, try talking to customer service if they havent sent it to you yet .

But if you did receive it, just go to “start” than "all programs " than go to the folder “accessories” and look for “remote desktop connection” / or you can just run your search.cmd and search for “remote desktop connection” and just type in the ip of ur vps and the password and than youll be able to setup your server on there .

Read full topic
